short_summary: NOTICE OF PROPOSED PROCUREMENT (NPP) For TASK BASED INFORMATICS PROFESSIONAL SERVICES (TBIPS).
description:
NOTICE OF PROPOSED PROCUREMENT (NPP) For TASK BASED INFORMATICS PROFESSIONAL SERVICES (TBIPS).\_
 \_
 This procurement has been set aside under the federal government's Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business (PSIB).\_
 
 The Information Systems Branch (ISB) of Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada (AAFC) has requirements on an 'as and when requested' basis for experienced IM/IT professionals to provide Project Enablement Services for Science and Business Solutions.\_
 
 This requirement is to establish a Task Authorization Contract with one qualified TBIPS Supply Arrangement (SA) Holder to provide resources with expertise in project enablement services. These services will provide support to ISB's clients and employees by providing additional capacity to ISB's existing personnel.',
duration_in_months: The contract will be in-place for approximately 15 months.
full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement

## TBIPS Project Enablement Services for Science and Business Solutions

### Submission Reference Number: cb-635-12793607
### Solicitation Number: 01B68-24-0748
### Publication Date: November 20, 2024
### Tender Closing Date: December 5, 2024, at 2:00 PM EST
### Expected Contract Start Date: February 3, 2025
### Expected Contract End Date: March 31, 2026

Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada is inviting qualified vendors to participate in the procurement of Task Based Informatics Professional Services (TBIPS) for Project Enablement Services.

## Procurement Overview
This procurement process is set aside under the federal government’s Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business (PSIB). The Information Systems Branch (ISB) of Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada requires experienced IM/IT professionals to provide on-demand services for project enablement.

## Requirement Summary
We are seeking a qualified Task Authorization Contract holder to provide resources with expertise in project enablement services. These services will support ISB's clients and employees by providing additional capacity to ISB's existing personnel.

## Procurement Method
This procurement will be conducted through a Request for Proposal (RFP) process, where the successful bidder will be selected based on the highest combined rating of technical merit and price.

## Qualification Criteria
To be considered for this procurement, vendors must meet the following qualification criteria:

* Be a registered supplier with the Government of Canada
* Have experience in providing task-based informatics professional services
* Have a proven track record in delivering project enablement services

## Contact Information
For more information, please contact:
Eleana Duff
eleana.duff@agr.gc.ca
(555) 555-5555

## Tender Documents
The tender documents, including the Request for Proposal (RFP) document and the Task Authorization Contract, are available for download on the [Canada Buys website](https://canadabuys.canada.ca).

Note: The RFP document is available in both English and French.

Please ensure that all inquiries and submissions are made in accordance with the instructions outlined in the tender documents. We look forward to receiving your proposal!
